data.title: Double Bridge Run
data.meta_description: We are Pensacola Sports, Florida’s first and oldest sports organizing and management group, and the area leader in amateur and professional participant sports, event management, marketing and promotions in the Pensacola and Northwest Florida Region.
data.text:
Course Start Line

5K

The starting line for the 5K race is at 10 Daniel St. in Gulf Breeze. (Adjacent to the Gulf Breeze High School Football Field)

15K*

The starting line for the 15K race is at Maritime Park 301 West Main Street, Pensacola, FL 32502.

Both races will take runners over the Bob Sikes Bridge to the finish line at the Pensacola Beach Boardwalk parking lot.

*15K runners are required to keep a 14-minute per mile pace.

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

Parking

All participants are encouraged to park at the beach and we will bus you to the start. The main Casino Beach Parking Lot is the preferred parking lot. The overflow lot will be at Park West, the entrance of Fort Pickens, which is 2.5 miles from Casino Beach Parking Lot.

If you choose to park at the start:

15K – Park in the Maritime Stadium parking lot until it reaches capacity. Additional parking is available in nearby parking structures. There will NOT be a shuttle back to your car.

5K – Park in the Gulf Breeze High School parking lot on the west side of Highway 98 across from the High School football stadium. After parking, take the crosswalk over Highway 98 to get to the starting area. There will NOT be a shuttle back to your car

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

Pre-race Shuttle Schedules

Shuttle buses will run before the race ONLY.

15K buses leave Casino Beach Parking Lot on Pensacola Beach at 5:00 a.m.- 6:00 a.m. If you are staying at one of the host: the Holiday Inn Resort, Hilton Pensacola Beach or Hampton Inn, your shuttle bus will begin loading at 5:30 a.m. near the front entrance. Plan to arrive early.

5K buses leave Casino Beach Parking Lot on Pensacola Beach at 6:00 a.m.-7:30 a.m. If you are staying at one of the host: the Holiday Inn Resort, Hilton Pensacola Beach or Hampton Inn, your shuttle bus will begin loading at 7:00 am near the front entrance. Plan to arrive early.

There is a toll-by-plate fee to get onto the beach on race morning.

Buses load at Sidelines Sports Bar and Restaurant.

Buses will drop you at your appropriate starting area. Be sure you are on the correct shuttle for your race.

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

Course and Timing

Both the 5k and 15K races will be scored and age category prizes awarded based on NET TIME, meaning you will only be scored for when you cross the start and finish lines, not when the gun goes off. Overall awards are scored based on gun time. The 15K start will have a corral start. Please go to the corral that coincides with your minute-per-mile pace. The 15k has a 14-minute-per-mile pace requirement.

Both races will be scored using the IPICO electronic timing system. All bibs will have a disposable chip, you must wear your bib properly in order to be timed. Once you have crossed the finish line keep moving forward. No chips to remove!

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

The entire course will close at 9:30 a.m.

The starting line for the 15K race is at Maritime Park 301 West Main Street, Pensacola, FL 32502.

The starting line for the 5K race is at 10 Daniel St. in Gulf Breeze.

There will be 3 water stations. One near the 2-, 6-, and 8-mile markers.

The finish line for both races will be in the Pensacola Beach Boardwalk parking lot. 15K runners are required to keep a 14-minute per mile pace.

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

Gear Bag Check

Convenient bag check at both start areas enables you to have a change of clothes and essentials delivered to the finish line for your comfort.

You MUST use the clear bag provided to you at packet pickup to place your pre and post run clothes. We will not accept any other bags or clothing not in the clear bag provided to you.

A gear check card is provided to you inside your race bag. It is your responsibility to place it visibly in your bag when you drop it off at the Bag Drop truck. Gear bags will be transported for you from the start areas to the finish line area.

Gear must be checked by:

6:40am for 15K

8:10am for 5K.

Gear Bag check will be located at the Rowes Moving Trucks at both starts. Gear will be immediately available at the finish area UNTIL 10:00 a.m. We ask that you not put valuables in your gear bag. We are not responsible for lost or stolen items. The race is not responsible for bags not picked up by 10:00 a.m.

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

On-course Entertainment and Aid Stations

On the 15k course, aid stations are located at approximately the 2-, 6-, and 8-mile marks.

On the 5k course, the aid station will be located at the 2-mile mark.

There will be spring water, medical support, and portable toilets at each aid station as well as the start and finish areas. There will be DJs and bands on the course strategically placed to keep you entertained and motivated.

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

Packet Pickup/Late Registration

Expo, Packet Pickup and Late Registration (if not sold out) will be at Hilton Pensacola Beach:

Thursday, January 30

3:00 PM – 7:00 PM

Friday, January 31

12:00 PM – 7:00 PM

Proxy Pick-Up is available. The person picking up the packet that is not theirs will have to sign for it.

Day of race packet pick-up is not recommended but will be available for those not able to make the Thursday or Friday time.

The expo will feature vendor booths.

NO DAY OF RACE REGISTRATION

There are NO strollers, bikes, rollerblades, or dogs allowed in either race.

Race T-Shirts

Participants will receive a 100% soft polyester long-sleeve shirt. Both men’s and women’s cuts are available.

Please specify the size of shirt you would like when you submit your race application. There will be NO Shirt Exchanges at packet pickup or on Race Day. The size you choose is the size you will get. Please pay attention to your selection of either a Men's or Women's cut when selecting.

Size and/or availability of shirts are not guaranteed to late registrants.

Benefactor

This is a Pensacola Sports event. Pensacola Sports is a private 501(c)3 non – profit organization primarily funded from revenues generated from membership, partnerships and events. Our focus is education, inspiration and participation in various team, individual, amateur and professional sports activities. Our annual programming includes free youth sports clinics aimed at introducing sports to all children as well as provide safe, fun activities for area youth, the Senior Scholar Athlete Banquet which awards over $100,000 in scholarships partnering with multiple organizations in the community, a high school all-star series for volleyball, football, soccer, basketball, baseball and softball which gives senior athletes recognition and a chance to play in front of college coaches and much more. Many Pensacola Sports events also directly engage and benefit organizations such as Arc Gateway, The Optimist Club, Police Cadet Programs and area Rotary Clubs.

In addition to our event management, Pensacola Sports is the Sport Tourism marketing agency for Escambia county investing annually in worthwhile local sports initiatives.
